page.title: 16GAME MANAGEMENT IN FINZEAN.
page.content: Records in pre Reformation times often referred to the Bishop's hunting grounds.Today shooting of game continues this ancient tradition and all game is carefully conserved. {Red and roe deer, capercailzie,duck, {pheasant,partridge,snipe,woodcock, {grouse,blackgame,hares and rabbits}are all found. Profits from game are pooled into the estate{economy}and contribute significantly to the{local {taxation system. Grouse,blackgame,hares and partridges are{declining}because of the{changes {in agricultural}practice.Pheasants are both wild and partly reared. Small woods ,planted to conserve game, and the winter feeding by gamekeepers help to conserve other forms of wildlife.
